classDescription: Someone has to play to healer.

textElements.regularText:
During combat the Priest deepens his connection with the Aether and they use that connection to empower their spells or other magical abilities.
At the start of the fight the Priest rolls a number of d6 equal to half their [SPI] (rounded down). These dice represent the current Aether dice pool, the lower the value the more they represent good and the higher the values the more they represent Evil. During the battle these dice can change and additional dice are added.

bulletPoints: At the start of each of the Priest’s turn he receives ona Aether dice of random value.
Falling Unconcious removes all current Aether Dice.

textElements.regularText: The Priest also gains additional Aether Dice depending on their Allignment

bulletPoints: Good: The first time during a [ROUND] you heal an ally or grant a positive status effect, you gain one Aether Dice equal to d3.
Evil: The first time during a [ROUND] you damage an enemy or inflict a negative status effect on them you gain one Aether Dice equal d3+3.
Lawful: The first time during a [ROUND] you succeed a [SAVE] or remove a status effect from a creature you gain one Aether Dice you already have, if you have none none you can choose one.
Chaotic: The first time during a [ROUND] you turn a [D20 TEST] from a failure to a success or from a success to a failure, you gain a random aether dice.
Partial Neutral: You can trigger the ability of your other allignment twice per [ROUND].>
True Neutral: You gain an additional Aether Dice at the start of your Turn.

textElements.regularText: The following Notation is used for describing Aether Dice (AD) and desired Values:

bulletPoints: AD = Any Aether Dice
AD(1) = Aether Dice with a value of 1
AD(4+) = Aether Dice with a value of 4 or higher (4-6)
AD(3-) = Aether Dice with a value of 3 or lower (1-3)

textElements.regularText: If you are of good allignment, you gain access to the Divine Blessing ability. If you are of evil allignment you gain the Divine Curse ability. If you are neutral, you gain access to both.

ability.name: Divine Blessing
ability.description: A number of friendly creatures up to half your [CHA] (rounded down, minimum 1) recieve [THP] equal to your [SPI] and they recieve [BLESS 1]

ability.name: Unholy Curse
ability.description: You can target up to half your [CHA] , minimum 1 (rounded down) creatures. Make a [SPELLCASTING TEST] against their [WILLPOWER] on a success they recieve unholy damage equal to your [SPI] and the [BANE 1] status effect.

textElements.regularText: The Priest can use their [ARCANA] to fuel the Energies of the Aether. You gain access to the following ability:

ability.name: Fuel the Aether
ability.description: You can target up to half your [CHA] , minimum 1 (rounded down) creatures. Make a [SPELLCASTING TEST] against their [WILLPOWER] on a success they recieve unholy damage equal to your [SPI] and the [BANE 1] status effect.

textElements.regularText: The Priest is able to perform minor miracles as long as they keep their faith. These miracles can’t generally be used in combat and take concentration and a clear mind to perform. They gain the following ability:

ability.name: Minor Miracle
ability.description:
You invoke a minor miracle, choose one of the effects below:
Provide tasty food and drink for up to 20 people.
Heal a crature up to full [HP].
End all Tier 1 and 2 negative status effects affecting a Crature.
Restore 2 Stamina to all party members.
Alternative Miracle effect agreed if agreed by the GM.

After usage, Miracle recovery [DT] is 25.

textElements.regularText: Each time the Priest uses a Miracle Ability they can’t do so it any more. Once at the start of each day they make a prayer and make a [DT] 25 [SPI] [ATTRIBUTE TEST] which can’t be modified in any other way, on a success they can use miracles again. They can repeat the Test each following day where they reduce the [DT] by 5 until they succeed. Alternatively if the Priest Character acts well within their believes or played well the GM may grant them the Miracle again without rolling.

For each Aether dice with a value of 1 you currently have in your Aether Dice Pool you positively affect the battlefield in a 9m aura around you. The more 1 dice you have currently in your pool, the stronger the effects are:

bulletPoints: 1. The area within your aura is brightly lit.
2. Each friendly creature that is within the aura gains resistance([SPI]) against unholy damage.
3. Each evil creature that starts their turn in your aura recieves holy damage equal to your [SPI].

textElements.regularText: For each Aether dice with a value of 6 you currently have in your Aether Dice Pool you positively affect the battlefield in a 9m aura around you. The more 6 dice you have currently in your pool, the stronger the effects are:

bulletPoints: 1. Every good creature within the area is now vulnurable to unholy damage.
2. Each creature that starts their turn in your aura recieves unholy damage equal to your [SPI].
3. The area within your aura is shrouded in darkness through which you and your alies can see through. Only magical effects of a spell power greater than [SPI]/3 can illuminate it.

textElements.regularText: The Priest has exceptional faith in his believes and fears no danger. The Priest can use a half of their [SPI] for calculating [HARDNESS], [DODGE] and [TOUGHNESS] instead of [STR] [AGI] and [CON].
The Priest is now able to perform greater miracles in addition to the ones he can already do:

ability.name: Miracle
ability.description:
You invoke a miracle, choose one of the effects below:
Provide tasty food and drink for a village.
Heal your party to full [HP].
End all negative status effects affecting a Creature.
Restore 5 [STAMINA] to all party members.
Alternative Miracle effect agreed if agreed by the GM.

After usage, Miracle recovery [DT] is 50..

textElements.regularText: The Priest is now able to perform even greater miracles in addition to the ones he can already do:

ability.name: Miracle
ability.description:
You invoke a miracle, choose one of the effects below:
Provide tasty food and drink for a town.
Restore a creature to life which has died within the last hour.
Restore all [STAMINA] of your party.
Summon a cosmic to assist you
Alternative Miracle effect agreed if agreed by the GM.

After usage, Miracle recovery [DT] is 100.

textElements.regularText: The Priest is able to perform mighty acts that rival the power of a god-like being, these can be performed regardless if they are eligble to perform a miracle or not:

bulletPoints: If the Priest died or they soul became trapped or bound they can use this ability and come back alive with their soul being returned to them. Talk with the GM on how they came back.

They can sacrifice themselves and matyr for their allies or cause. When doing so they can’t be resurrected with their soul now being bound to the aether. For this sacriface they can alter reality in a major way they wish, examples: Forever bind an evli entity somewhere, reverse the destruction of a major city, ....

textElements.regularText: When performing such an act, they can’t do so again.

classTechniques.name: Lingering Healing
classTechniques.target: one ally that was targeted by a [SPELL ABILITY]
classTechniques.description: One ally that was targeted with a [SPELL ABILITY] that you cast this turn recieves [HEALING] equal to [SPI] .

classTechniques.name: Holy Strike
classTechniques.description: When you hit a target with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] or a [RANGED MARTIAL ATTACK] you can deal 2d6 extra holy damage. For every additional AD(3-) used, you can increase the holy damage by a further d6.

classTechniques.name: Mercy of the Gods
classTechniques.cost: 0 [AP], nubmer of AD(2-) equal to spell power
classTechniques.description: For your next [SPELL ABILITY] that you cast, that heals you can maximize all dice heal a target.

classTechniques.name: Rejuvination
classTechniques.description: You can target one ally within 6m that is [UNCONCIOUS]. That ally regains 1 [HP] and can immediatly stand up if they are able to move.

classTechniques.name: Holy Fire
classTechniques.description: You unleash a holy flame that deals holy damage to all evil creatures within range. Make a [SPI] [SPELLCASTING TEST] against the creature’s [DODGE] . On a success the damage is equal to a number of d8s equalt to your [LEVEL] [HALF].

classTechniques.name: Unholy Strike
classTechniques.description: When you hit a target with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] or a [RANGED MARTIAL ATTACK] you can deal 2d6 extra unholy damage. For every additional AD(4+) used, you can increase the unholy damage by a further d6.

classTechniques.name: Unholy Fire
classTechniques.description: You unleash an unholy flame that deals unholy damage to all creatures within range. Make a [SPI] [SPELLCASTING TEST] against the creature’s [DODGE]. On a success the damage is equal to a number of d8s equalt to your [LEVEL] [HALF].

classTechniques.name: Divine Clense
classTechniques.description: You can remove one Tier I status effect affecting the Target. If that target is a hostile creature you have to succeed on a [INT] [SPELLCASTING TEST] against: 10 + Creature [LEVEL]. When this ability is used with 4 matching AD Tier 2 Status Effects can be removed, When used with 6 matching AD Tier 3 status effects can be removed.

classTechniques.name: Protection
classTechniques.description: When an ally within 9m of the Priest recieves damage the Priest can use their reaction and reduce the damage by an amount equal to [SPI] + [LEVEL] ∗ 2.

classTechniques.name: Certainty
classTechniques.description: For the next [D20 TEST] you make during your turn, don’t roll a dice, instead it is a unmodified roll of 10. When this ability is used with 3 matching AD the roll becomes a 16 and when used with 4 matching AD the roll becomes a 20.

classTechniques.name: Sanctified Shackles
classTechniques.description: Make a [SPI] [SPELLCASTING TEST] against the targets [HARDNESS] or [DODGE] (target’s choice). On a success the target is [RESTRAINED] (Escape DC equal to 10 + [LEVEL] + [SPI]). When targeting a chaotic creature you have [ADVANTAGE] on the Test.

classTechniques.name: Unyielding
classTechniques.description: When you fail a [SAVE] you can turn add your [LEVEL] to the roll.

classTechniques.name: Second Chance
classTechniques.description: After a creature made a [D20 TEST] you can use this feature and the creature must reroll the test and take the second result.

classTechniques.name: Blessed Cast
classTechniques.description: The next spell you cast is cast as if it was cast one Spell Power higher without needing to expend extra [ARCANA] however if it is higher than your Spell Power Maximum you will still have to make a [SPELLCASTING TEST] to prevent an arcanae misshap as if you would upcast normally.
